creator: Rolf.Sponsel@kstr.lth.se
text:
Scanning for HTML Titles of (s)html-documents in an auto indexed directory,
using IndexOptions FancyIndexes and ScanHTMLTitles, just returns the first text
found <title>within</title> tags in the page; ignoring whether it's commented
out by means of HTML or SSI syntax.

Additional Info:

The following directives where used for the auto-indexed directory:

Options Indexes
IndexOptions +FancyIndexes
IndexOptions +ScanHTMLTitles
IndexOptions +DescriptionWith=*

I'm attaching a test document to verify the problem (and it's resolution).


Best Regards,
Rolf Sponsel

text:
This is probably a "wontfix" because it would require a full html-parser to do
correctly.  That would be slow and complicated.

Ahem - it's already slow and complicated!

It would be fairly straightforward to adapt relevant code from
mod_accessibility - which scans titles in linked pages (just as
mod_proxy_html was derived from it).  But I'm not volunteering:
I think mod_autoindex is already OTT.
